Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 29th overall pick, by New York (A) in 1965...
Traded from New York (A) to Kansas City on 6/24/1967 (Going to KCA: 2B G. Nettles. Going to NYY: 1B J. Mayberry Sr., 1B R. Skidmore)...
Had first career hit on 7/17/1967, off Dean Chance (CAL)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/28/1967, off Tom Seaver (CHW)...
Was selected to the 1970 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1971 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1973 Allstar game...
Injured on 7/1/1975 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Drove in 6 runs against California on 8/29/1975...
Won Batter of the Month award on 9/1/1975, hitting .389 with 9 HR, 26 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/1/1975, hitting .429 with 2 HR, 8 RBI...
Drove in 8 runs against Chicago (A) on 4/24/1976...
Won Batter of the Month award on 5/1/1976, hitting .368 with 7 HR, 26 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 7/1/1976, hitting .330 with 12 HR, 25 RBI...
Was selected to the 1976 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1979 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against Chicago (A) on 8/25/1979...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/1/1979, hitting .353 with 3 HR, 7 RBI...
Was selected to the 1980 Allstar game...
Had 2000th career hit on 5/2/1981, off Antonio Pollorena (CAL)...
Injured on 8/22/1981 with a Bone Chips Elbow, out for 5 weeks...
